alert.note: Alert for Bent (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued April 29 at 3:46PM MDT until April 29 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Bent County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 445 PM MDT. * At 345 PM MDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Higbee to near McClave, moving south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery and surface observations. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Highway 50 in Bent County. Locations impacted include... Las Animas, Hasty, McClave, John Martin Reservoir, Fort Lyon and Caddoa. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
